what: A Simple Workflow for Core Microbiota Analysis
title: Core Microbiota Analysis
text: goal coremicrobiota provide set functions easily perform core microbiota analysis ASV/OTU table. First, function sniff can rapidly get glimpse many members compose core microbiota given minimum relative abundance ubiquity. idea choose good values minimum relative abundance ubiquity, can make use distribution function, plot two histograms distribution values across dataset. , good go can now call core_microbiota function extract ASV/OTU names composing core microbiota (corresponding relative abundance across dataset ubiquity want). Finally, offer function core_heatmap draw ASVs/OTUs relative abundance across samples. utility function get_core_table also provided compute total counts, relative sequence abundance across dataset ubiquity ASV/OTU. Yes, function can take input phyloseq object. case, function core_microbiota return phyloseq object. package external dependencies joy. therefore, extensively use R Base packages suggests.

title: Core Microbiota Analysis
text: can install development version coremicrobiota like :
code: # Install devtools package (if not already done!) install.package("remotes")  # Load devtools package library(remotes)  # Install coremicrobiota package install_github("Ebedthan/coremicrobiota")

title: Core Microbiota Analysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(coremicrobiota)  # Some fake data asv_tbl <- data.frame(sample1 = 1:10, sample2 = 10:1, sample3 = 80:89) rownames(asv_tbl) <- paste0("ASV", "_", 1:10)  # First I want to know how many ASVs/OTUs are in my microbiota given # a certain minimum relative abundance and ubiquity sniff(asv_tbl) #> 10 ASVs/OTUs were found as members of the core microbiota  # How can I choose a good value for relative abundance and ubiquity? distribution(asv_tbl)  # When I am good... core_microbiota(asv_tbl, abundance = 9, ubiquity = 25)  # When I am done with core microbiota analysis... core_heatmamp(asv_tbl, abundance = 9, ubiquity = 25)  # If I want a nice table to include in my paper... get_core_table(asv_tbl, abundance = 9, ubiquity = 25)
